title: Introduction to CBT Concepts
description: Learn the foundational concepts of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)

questions.prompt: CBT focuses on how our thoughts, feelings, and behaviors are interconnected.
Which of these is a key principle of CBT?
options: Our thoughts directly influence how we feel and behave
Our past determines our future and cannot be changed
Mental health issues cannot be effectively treated without medication
Therapy should focus only on childhood experiences

questions.prompt: Describe a situation where you noticed your thoughts affecting your feelings or behavior:
questions.placeholder: Example: When I thought I would fail the test, I felt anxious and couldn't focus on studying...

questions.prompt: The CBT model proposes that these three elements influence each other:
Which of these is NOT a common goal of CBT?
How comfortable are you with the concept that your thoughts influence your feelings?
What do you hope to learn or achieve through CBT?
questions.placeholder: Example: I want to manage my anxiety better and learn how to challenge negative thoughts...

questions.prompt: CBT is considered what type of therapy?
CBT typically focuses more on present concerns than on your past history.
